original_title: Le Cœlacanthe, plongée vers nos origines
overview: 120 metres down off the wild coast of South Africa lives an animal once thought to have been extinct for 65 million years - the coelacanth, locally known as Gombessa. A dinosaur fish, a living fossil, that remains the only link connecting fish to terrestrial tetrapods: its fins contain the beginning of reptile and mammal leg bones! And what about the vestigial lung found at the back of its huge mouth?…  A team of underwater explorers will film these legendary fish like never before.
tagline: A unique human adventure and a media-worthy scientific project
title: Diving with the Coelacanth
